creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mr. and Mrs. James McClatchy
description: three long lines and one short line of looping, bold calligraphy; lines of smaller characters at left; three red seals--two in LLC, one in URC; blue floral mount; ivory roller ends
inscription: in black: (Looking west from Dongting Lake/the River Chu begins;/Its waters end at thesouthern sky/with one thousand clouds./It\'s a pity that the autumn colours are so distant;/How shall I mourn the God of the Xiang River?//Ryu Kobi, 1783, at age 69) (AS) (see file)
markings: URC and LLC, in red: three seals
title: Distant Autumn Colors
